title: Understanding Chromatographic Resolution
text: Resolution in chromatography is a measure of how well two components are separated. It is influenced by several factors, including the choice of stationary and mobile phases.

title: Role of Stationary Phase
text: The stationary phase plays a crucial role in separation. Different stationary phases can interact differently with the components of a mixture, affecting their retention times.

title: Mobile Phase Composition
text: The composition of the mobile phase can be adjusted to improve separation. Consider how polarity, pH, and other properties of the mobile phase can influence the interaction with the stationary phase.

hintAnswer: The choice of stationary phase and mobile phase composition
title: Choosing the Right Factors
text: Which factor is crucial for optimizing the resolution in chromatographic separations?
choices: The choice of stationary phase and mobile phase composition
The size of the sample container
